questions.stem: A 19-year-old nonpregnant woman is a marathon runner and is complaining of amenorrhea, which is most likely due to:
A 33-year-old woman has amenorrhea lyr ago since her last VD that was complicated by severe PPH. She was unable to breast feed her baby. Most likely cause of this condition is:
Commonest cause of precocious puberty includes:
A 32-year-old G1P1 woman presents with an 8months amenorrhea. A pregnancy test is negative. TSH, PRL are normal. FSH is 40IU/L. Most likely complication for this patient:
options: She is at significant risk for Endometrial cancer.
She is at significant risk for Ovarian cancer.
She is at significant risk for Osteoporosis.
She is at significant risk of Breast cancer.
She is at significant risk for Multiple gestations.

questions.stem: If the previous patient is to have a diagnostic work-up, the most likely to be noted is:
options: Obliterated uterine cavity on saline infusion sonography.
No bleeding with progestin challenge test.

questions.stem: A 41-year-old woman is suspected of having intrauterine adhesions. which of the following historical or laboratory information would be present in this patient:
options: FSH level too low to be measured.
Normal estradiol levels for her reproductive age.
Abnormal sella turcica on CT brain.

questions.stem: If MRI shows a mass in the posterior pituitary gland. the following hormone is suspected to be elevated:
A 33-year-old woman who is pregnant 28 weeks, has a microadenoma of the pituitary gland. Best therapy is:

A 34-year-old woman had no menses since she had a cone biopsy lyear ago. Since then, she complains of severe cramping lower abdominal pain for 5days each month. Her BBT chart is biphasic. Most likely cause of amenorrhea:
A 24-year-old woman G1P1 is complaining of 2ry amenorrhea since her last delivery that was complicated with severe PPH. The following is consistent with her diagnosis:
options: Usually associated with hypertensive crisis at or soon after delivery.
Caused by an ischemic necrosis of the posterior pituitary gland.

questions.stem: Best description of the mechanism of Asherman syndrome is:
A 25-year-old woman presents with a 6months amenorrhea. Her pregnancy test is negative. She is diagnosed as PCOS. The following is consistent with her disorder:
A 15-year-old female is diagnosed with gonadal dysgenesis. She has delayed puberty, short stature and elevated gonadotropin levels. The following is generally present:
Select the correct statement regarding Kallmann's syndrome:
options: It is due to pituitary anomaly.
It occurs in short statured persons.
It is associated with anomaly in the olfactory bulb.

questions.stem: An 18-year-old woman complains of 1ry amenorrhea. She has normal breast, pubic and axillary hair development, blind ended vaginal pouch and no cervix. Most likely diagnosis:
A 19-year-old woman with primary amenorrhea and normal breast development, she has a pelvic kidney. The most likely diagnosis is:
The following is the best explanation for breast development in a patient with AIS:
A mother brings her 12-year-old daughter for consultation as most of her class mates had started their menses, while she hasn't. You should ask the mother about:
options: Has your daughter had any acne?
Has your daughter started to develop breasts?
Does your daughter have any pubic hair?
Does your daughter have any axillary hair?
Has your daughter had any vaginal spotting?

questions.stem: A 68-year-old healthy woman presents for advice regarding the risk of developing osteoporosis. Her height is 160cm, her weight is 40kg with regular treadmill walks. She was menopausal at 42yrs old. She doesn't take HRT. Her mother died at 72yrs from complicated spontaneous hip fracture. The risk for developing osteoporosis in this case include all the following EXCEPT:

A 17-year-old patient hasn't started her period. She is 125cm tall with no breast buds or pubic hair. Her pelvic examination reveals a uterus and cervix, but the ovaries are not palpable. FSH, LH are high. The most likely diagnosis is:
The following may occur as a result of Sheehan syndrome EXCEPT:
Tubal patency is screened by:
A 55-year-old woman comes to your office to discuss menopause. You tell her that all the following are part of this stage EXCEPT:
A 52-year-old recently menopausal female has developed severe hot flushes. She recently takes no medications nor ERT. Most effective to relieve her symptoms:
The following medical treatment is effective in treating hyperprolactinemia:
A 56-year-old female has been on combined hormone therapy for 6months. This is associated with a reduced risk for which of the following:

A 15-year-old patient is evaluated for masculinization and amenorrhea. She has excessive facial hair growth. She is 160cm tall. She has prominent musculature and under-developed breasts. Pelvic examination reveals enlarged clitoris, moderate posterior labial-scrotal fusion, and the cervix is seen in the vaginal vault. There are no pelvic masses on bimanual examination. This patient's chromosomes are most likely:

A mother brings in her 16-year-old daughter because she hasn't ever had menses. O/E the girl is 173 tall with mature breast development, scanty pubic and axillary hair. PV is difficult and you are unable to identify a cervix nor palpate a uterus. Most likely diagnosis:

A 35-year-old accountant complains of episodic bloating, breast tenderness, dyspareunia, irritability and depression which leave her with "only one good week a month". Pelvic examination is normal. The best diagnostic course:
options: Begin a prospective diary of symptoms for the next 2months.
Obtain a serum progesterone level during the last half of her menstrual cycle.
Obtain a serum estrogen level during the first half of her menstrual cycle.

questions.stem: In the previous patient, which symptom is most consistent with her diagnosis:

A 25-year-old athlete with BMI: 18 presents to the fertility clinic after trying for pregnancy for 2years. She has oligomenorrhea and her partner's semen analysis is within normal. She has low FSH, LH and estrogen levels, while androgen profile is normal. Best strategy for ovarian stimulation:
options: Lifestyle intervention (normalize weight and exercise) + HMG.

questions.stem: A 16-year-old girl presents with 1ry amenorrhea. She has Tanner V breast, pubic hair development. O/E she has blind ending vagina. Karyotype is 46XX. Most likely diagnosis:
A 50-year-old patient is due to have a major abdominal surgery. she is currently taking combined continuous HRT. when should she stop HRT before surgery:
The most reliable test to check for ovulation is:
Which test from the routine workup will give an idea about ovarian reserve:
Which test is confirmatory about ovarian reserve:
The following is not controlled by hypothalamic releasing hormones:
Which of the following causes hyperprolactinemia?
The luteal phase of menstrual cycle is associated with:
The cause of menopause is:
options: Depletion of ovarian store of follicles.

questions.stem: The use of estrogen alone as HRT in menopausal women is contraindicated as it increases the risk of:
Which of the following may cause cryptomenorrhea?

A 52-year-old woman comes to the physician because of severe hot flashes. Her LMP was 1year ago. She has no medical problems, takes no medications. She has a family history of cardiovascular disease and she does not smoke. Physical examination is unremarkable. Your management should include:
All the following symptoms may be present in this woman EXCEPT:

A 15-year-old patient presents with primary amenorrhea. O/E, secondary sexual characteristics are absent. Investigation reports a high serum FSH. Based on this, which of the following is the MOST likely diagnosis:
The next investigation should be:
What is the appropriate management in this case:
options: Consultation with internal medicine for kidney and cardiovascular problems.

questions.stem: A 26-year-old patient presents 1ry infertility for 2 years. Her hormonal evaluation and ovulation were found to be normal. Her pelvic US revealed normal findings. She has a recent normal HSG and her husband semen analysis was reported to be normal. She has normal recent potcoital test. Her family history is irrelevant. The following procedure is advisable at this stage for the diagnosis of the cause of infertility:
During the evaluation of infertility in a 25-year-old woman, a HSG showed evidence of Asherman syndrome. Which of the following symptoms would you expect this patient to have:
Progesterone is secreted by:
In Turner syndrome: which is true?
The following are recognized causes of secondary amenorrhea EXCEPT:

A 49-year-old woman complains of irregular menses over the past 6months, vaginal dryness, difficulty sleeping, and episodes of warmth and sweating at night. Ο/Ε, BP: 120/68, HR: 90, temp 36.8. Cardiac and lung examinations are unremarkable. Examination of the external genitalia does not reveal any masses. What is the most likely diagnosis:
What is your next diagnostic step?
An increased risk of osteoporosis is associated with:
Hypothyroidism can affect fertility by causing:
Compared to clomiphene citrate, HMG have:
options: Higher incidence of ovarian hyper-stimulation syndrome (OHSS).

questions.stem: Precocious puberty has many physical and psychological effects. One of the effects is not reversible or correctable and has major long-term implications:
A patient has profuse thin cervical mucus with a degree of stretchability and a palm-leaf pattern. The following is compatible with this finding:
options: The secretory phase of the menstrual cycle.

questions.stem: A 21-year-old medical student presents with increasing nervousness, fatigue, weight loss and palpitations. She has stressful academic load but normal monthly menses. She lost 4kg in one month, has warm skin but no goiter. She also has tachycardia without murmurs or clicks. What is the next step in her evaluation?
options: Provide psychiatric/psychological referral for stress management.

questions.stem: The following is true about longitudinal vaginal septum EXCEPT:
options: It results from improper fusion of the two Mullerian ducts.
It is treated surgically by excision of the septum.
It does not interfere with vaginal delivery.

questions.stem: Cryptomenorrhea may be present with all the following presentations EXCEPT:
Normal luteal phase vaginal cytology shows one of the following characteristics:
From an outflow tract perspective, the uterine anomaly that may cause a problem is:

A 26-year-old patient attends to check her fertility as she will marry soon. Her menses are irregular since menarche with repeated amenorrhea for several cycles. Her BMI is 40, she has mild hirsutism and US shows increased ovarian volume with increased peripheral small follicles. What your provisional diagnosis?
What is the suitable initial management?
This patient attends again after 9 months of continuous marital life with delayed conception. Semen analysis is normal and HSG reveals no abnormality with patent tubes. How will you proceed?
This patient has a delayed cycle for few days with +ve pregnancy test that is followed by vaginal bleeding. What is the most probable cause in this condition?
What is your recommendation after this event?
options: Luteal support by progesterone in next cycles.

questions.stem: Amenorrhea following delivery may be explained by any of the following EXCEPT:
All the following can cause hirsutism EXCEPT:
The karyotype of patient with androgen insensitivity syndrome is:

A newly married 22-year-old woman consults due to increased facial acne. 2nd day FSH: 4miu/ml LH: 12miu/ml. TVS: increased ovarian volume with increased number of small follicles. The patient wishes to conceive soon. Most suitable treatment for her:
Which of the following is suggestive of ovulation:
options: BBT drops at least 0.5 degree in the second half of the cycle.
Progesterone level on day 10 of the cycle is elevated.

questions.stem: Ovulation occurs:
options: After follicles ripened in the ovary.

questions.stem: Menopause is best diagnosed by:
Spinnbarkeit is a term which means:
The initial evaluation in an infertile couple should include:
Ovulation can be diagnosed by the following measures EXCEPT:
options: Observing a rise in BBT in the 2nd half of the cycle.

questions.stem: Recognized feature of Sheehan syndrome:
In PCO:
options: There is increased sensitivity to insulin.
Has no change in FSH: LH ratio.
Sex hormone binding globulin are increased.

questions.stem: Secondary amenorrhea may be related to:
After menopause, which of the following is true:
options: Recurrent vaginal bleeding should be investigated by endometrial biopsy.
Malignancy is the leading cause of postmenopausal bleeding.

questions.stem: Premenstrual tension should be initially treated with:
Androgen insensitivity syndrome:
options: Characteristic include normal uterus/ breast development and ambiguous genitalia.
Gonadectomy must be performed after puberty due to increased risk of malignancy.
ERT is not indicated because they have enough estrogens to produce breast development.

questions.stem: Optimal development of the corpus luteum is most closely associated with:
A 54-year-old menopausal woman, on HRT for hot flushes, presents with irregular vaginal bleeding for 2 weeks. Bleeding is spontaneous, bright red and painless. How would you counsel this case?
options: Estrogen dose in HRT should be increased.
Discontinue HRT and check her after few months.

questions.stem: This patient inquired about her regular screening program. What is the most recommended investigation for the future?
A 16-year-old girl, presents with her mother as she has cyclic severe pelvic cramps and vomiting in the first 2 days of her flow. What is the most likely cause?
What will be your first line of treatment?
The most common cause of female infertility is:
Percentage of couple who are unable to conceive after one year of coitus:
A 31-year-old patient is preparing to start IVF due to obstructed tubes. Her HSG shows bilateral hydrosalpinx, what should be your next step:
options: Patient should begin her IVF treatment cycle.
Patient should not be offered the opportunity of IVF.
Bilateral salpingectomies should be done prior to starting IVF.
Hydrosalpinx should be drained via transvaginal aspiration prior to IVF.
Hydrosalpinx should be drained via laparoscopy prior to IVF.

questions.stem: A 22-year-old woman with amenorrhea 6weeks, undergoes surgery for acute appendicitis. At the time of surgery, a 3cm Lt vascular with blood-filled central cavity ovarian cyst is discovered. Pregnancy test is positive. Most appropriate next step:

A 33-year-old woman who underwent normal puberty has 18months period of secondary amenorrhea and hot flushes. Her pregnancy test is negative. Her FSH: 98 miu/ml, her LH: 68miu/ml. She desires pregnancy. Most appropriate next step:
Physical stigmata of Turner syndrome are due to loss of chromosomal material from:
A 33-year-old G2P1 presents with milky nipple discharge from both breasts even without expression. All the following may be a cause EXCEPT:

A 27-year-old G1P1comes to your office 8months after an uncomplicated vaginal delivery of a healthy male newborn as she has been trying to conceive for 3months, but failed and she is very anxious about this. She is still breast feeding routinely. What is the likely underlying cause of her condition?
options: Thyroid hormone suppression of the anterior pituitary.
Abnormal endometrial regeneration causing failure of implantation.
Prolactin-induced inhibition of pulsatile GnRH from the hypothalamus.
Reduced tubal motility 2ry to subclinical inflammation after vaginal delivery.
Pathological decreased sperm count of the male partner.

questions.stem: A 30-year-old patient with PCO, started OCPs to reduce her symptoms of acne and hirsutism. After 6months of use, she is pleased with the aesthetic improvement and wonders how the birth control pill works to improve her symptoms. This is due to:
options: Lower sex hormone binding globulin, and therefore lowering circulating testosterone.
Increased sex hormone binding globulin and therefore higher circulating testosterone.
Increased sex hormone binding globulin and therefore lower circulating testosterone.
Stimulation of LH production leading to lower circulating testosterone.

questions.stem: Hyperprolactinemia can be caused by all the following EXCEPT:

A 25-year-old healthy woman complains of breast tenderness and amenorrhea for 6weeks duration. O/E: a whitish breast discharge is noticed. Pregnancy test is negative, TSH is normal, PRL is 80ng/ml. Radiological assessment may be needed on:
A patient presents with galactorrhea. Prolactin level shows three folds elevation. The following is a normal physiologic reason for such condition:
Causes of secondary amenorrhea include:
Selection of the dominant follicle in the menstrual cycle is mainly due to:
options: High level of FSH at start of the follicular phase.
Low level of LH at early follicular phase.
Increased FSH receptors in the selected follicle.
Least aromatase activity in the selected follicle.

questions.stem: Regarding luteal phase defect, choose the correct answer:
options: Serum progesterone is less than 5ng/ml in day 21
Premenstrual endometrial biopsy shows proliferative endometrium.
Common cause of recurrent 2nd trimesteric abortion.
Common to occur with clomiphene citrate use for ovulation induction.

questions.stem: The following is best done at any time of the menstrual cycle in infertility cases:

An unmarried 18-year-old female presented with excess facial hair growth. She had regular cycles and US revealed bilateral increase in ovarian size with dense stroma and peripherally arranged equal size small follicles. Most suitable treatment for her is:
The luteal phase of the menstrual cycle is associated with:

A long statured unmarried 20-year-old with average BMI has primary amenorrhea with normally developed breast, absent pubic and axillary hair, past history of inguinal hernia repair at age of 2 years. US sows absent uterus. Most likely diagnosis is:
Which of the following may cause 2ry dysmenorrhea?
A 13-year-old girl presents with cyclic lower abdominal pain for 6months. She has no menses. On separating the labia, a tense bluish bulge is seen. Most probable diagnosis:
What is the most important determinant factor for ovarian reserve?
PCO can be associated with all the following EXCEPT:
options: Reduced level of total and free testosterone.

questions.stem: A couple with a delayed conception for 8months attend the clinic seeking fertility. Male is smoker with semen analysis of 15million/ ml and decreased motility. Female is 25-year-old with normal hormonal profile and HSG. most suitable next step:
options: Male treatment and re-do semen analysis after 6months.

questions.stem: Normal parameters of semen analysis include:
Normal parameters of semen analysis include:
options: Motility: at least 80% or more with progressive motility.

questions.stem: The following are used to check ovulation EXCEPT:
Regarding clomiphene citrate:
options: Used in hypothalamic causes of infertility.
Used in pituitary causes of infertility.
Cannot be used without HCG triggering.
Most common medication used for induction of ovulation.
Effective in cases with premature ovarian failure.

questions.stem: Polycystic ovarian disease is characterized by:
options: Association with insulin dependent diabetes mellitus.

questions.stem: A60-year-old woman complains of vaginal dryness & dyspareunia. First management is:
HSG of an infertile patient shows Asherman's syndrome. Your treatment plan is:
options: Laparoscopic lysis of the adhesions + clomiphene citrate therapy.
Hysteroscopic lysis of adhesions + estrogen therapy.
Laparoscopic lysis of adhesions + gestagens therapy.
Hysteroscopic lysis of the adhesions + GnRH analogues.
Laparotomy for adhesiolysis and timed intercourse.

questions.stem: Effects of progesterone production in menstrual cycle include:
options: Facilitates upward transfer of sperms at day of ovulation.
Renders the endometrium suitable for implantation.
Responsible for colicky pains at onset of menstrual flow.
Exerts +ve feedback on FSH and LH in mid-luteal period.

questions.stem: As regard induction of ovulation by Clomiphene citrate:
options: Effective in cases with Sheehan syndrome.
Risk of having a malformed fetus is doubled.
The treatment of choice in adolescent girls with anovulation.
Human chorionic gonadotropins should be given to ensure ovulation.

questions.stem: A 23-year-old woman complains of heavy menstrual periods, associated with cramping pain, every 2weeks. And every other episode, there is very brief painful spotting for 2days. Her BBT is biphasic. Her physical examination is normal. the most likely diagnosis:
The post ovulation cervical mucus is characterized by:
Hormonal assays commonly required for infertility assessment include:
options: Serum FSH and LH at day 21 of the cycle.
Urinary estriol level to detect impending ovulation within 48 hrs.
Serum progesterone at day 14 of the cycle.

questions.stem: Regarding surgical induction of ovulation:
options: It is the most preferred induction method.
Has an extended ovulation effect up to 3yrs.
Has no effect on ovarian reserve.
Effective in all forms of anovulation.

questions.stem: What is the most serious complication in IVF/ICSI:
options: Allergic reactions to ovulation induction agents.

questions.stem: The success rate of IVF/ICSI cycles depend upon these factors EXCEPT:
A 35-year-old with 2ry amenorrhea, has +ve withdrawal progesterone challenge test, this occurs in:

A 30-year-old female is concerned about irregular menses (fewer than 9/year), acne and hirsutism. Her BMI is 36. She has no other medical problems and would like to have a baby. Her FBS is 135mg/dl. Most appropriate treatment:
options: Lifestyle modification and an oral contraceptive.

questions.stem: Under the effect of progesterone, cervical mucus shows:

A 19-year-old, unmarried female, presented to ER with acute Rt abdominal pain 1 week after the end of her menses. This pain is associated with a mild increase in vaginal secretions and blood spotting. US revealed a normal sized AVF uterus and a Rt adnexal clear cystic structure 20mm in diameter. What is your provisional diagnosis for this case?
Regarding clomiphene citrate:
options: Improves endometrial receptivity by its estrogenic effect.
May result in mild ovarian hyperstimulation.
The treatment of choice in adolescent girls with menstrual irregularities.

questions.stem: Menopause is characterized by one of the following:
options: Hot flushes usually start few years after complete cessation of menstruation.
Risk of osteoporosis is the same as elderly men in the same age.

questions.stem: Cryptomenorrhea is caused by one of the following pathologies:
Polycystic ovarian disease commonly includes one of the following characteristics:
options: Multiple large dominant follicles in ultrasound.

questions.stem: A 30-year-old P0+1 presented with 2ry amenorrhea for lyear following surgical evacuation of 10weeks pregnancy. She received cyclic oral contraceptive pills for few months but no withdrawal bleeding occurred. Your provisional diagnosis:
In postmenopausal women:
options: Malignancy is the commonest cause of postmenopausal bleeding.
FSH and LH are characteristically low.
Fibroid uterus tends to grow bigger.
HRT increases the risk of breast cancer.
Endometrium is characteristically thick on US.

questions.stem: A 35-year-old P1+0 with 2ry amenorrhea for 6 months. FSH: 40miu/ml.
A 35-year-old with delayed conception. 2nd day hormonal level: FSH: 3miu/ml, LH: 7 miu/ml.
A 29-year-old with 2ry amenorrhea for 1 year following vaginal delivery that was complicated by severe postpartum hemorrhage. She didn't lactate and FSH: 1 miu/ml.

A 22-year-old, obese, unmarried with 2ry amenorrhea for 3 months associated with facial acne and hirsutism. US shows bilateral increased ovarian stromal size with increased number of peripheral small follicles.

A 25-year-old G2P1, previous surgical evacuation for missed abortion and developed amenorrhea since then. Negative withdrawal bleeding after estrogen/progesterone therapy. FSH: 5 miu/ml, LH: 4 miu/ml.
This is associated with raised free androgen, low progesterone.
The most common cause of tubal disease.
The only treatment is donor insemination.
An oral treatment for anovulation.
The most common cause of hirsutism is constitutional.
Induction of ovulation in Kallman syndrome is best done by clomiphene citrate.
Progesterone level more than 5ng/ml on day 21, indicates ovulation.
Hyperprolactinemia is commonly treated by dopamine agonists.
Most commonly used investigations to diagnose ovulation are vaginal ultrasound and serum progesterone level.
Most common cause of 2ry amenorrhea is premature ovarian failure.
Precocious puberty is commonly associated with long stature.
The commonest cause of secondary amenorrhea is pregnancy.
In the normal menstrual cycle, ovulation occurs 12 hours prior to LH surge.
The commonest cause of anovulation is polycystic ovarian disease.
Commonest cause of secondary amenorrhea is PCO.
Menopausal females have relatively alkaline vaginal pH.
